task.title: Removing the Drive Shaft Pinion
task.shortdesc: This task describes how to remove the pinion from the tapered end of the drive shaft where it is secured by a castle nut.

context.p: The drive shaft pinion is attached to the tapered end of the shaft using a key and is secured with a castle nut and cotter pin.

step.info: Extract the cotter pin from the castle nut
Unscrew the castle nut that secures the pinion to the shaft
Use appropriate force to drive the pinion off the tapered end of the shaft
